intro: Molopospermum cicutifolium, commonly known as the cut-leaved molopospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves that resemble those of the cuckoo flower, giving it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Molopospermum cicutifolium is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
